problem.p: Has a student that passed 90% of the assessments in a course necessarily mastered all the latent skills covered by the course?

choicegroup.label: Is a graded quiz or assignment a good idea?
choicegroup.choice: No It is possible that the remaining 10% of assessments require mastery of a very different set of skills than the other 90%, which means that the student may still be missing some skills. The takeaway is that in a course that tests certain skills more than others, good grades can mask weaknesses in skills with less content coverage.
